rows.text_1_facilitator:
I'M HUNGRY! HE HIT ME! I'M BORED!
Sound familiar? 

Every family faces big and small challenges. Learning how to solve problems together with your child can help you prevent conflict in your home. 

It also teaches your children how to solve problems on their own. 

This will set them up for success throughout their life. What a gift to give them!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
I'M HUNGRY! HE HIT ME! I'M BORED!
Sound familiar? 

Every family faces big and small challenges. Learning how to solve problems together with your child can help you prevent conflict in your home. 

It also teaches your children how to solve problems on their own. 

This will set them up for success throughout their life. What a gift to give them!

media_title.eng: How will it help me and my family?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

As parents, it can feel like we have to solve a million problems for our children every day: Where is my toy car? I am not going to school! Why can’t you buy me a new toy now?

By involving our children in solving problems, they learn to find solutions more and more independently. 

Life has its challenges. If you help your child solve small problems today, you give them the skills to deal with any bigger challenges later in life.

As parents, it can feel like we have to solve a million problems for our children every day: Where is my toy car? I am not going to school! Why can’t you buy me a new toy now?

By involving our children in solving problems, they learn to find solutions more and more independently. 

Life has its challenges. If you help your child solve small problems today, you give them the skills to deal with any bigger challenges later in life.

rows.text_1_facilitator: @data.characters.f3_mother.name is concerned that @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name is sleeping late every day and waking up tired because she starts her homework late. Let’s see how they try to solve the problem together:

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f3_mother.name is concerned that @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name is sleeping late every day and waking up tired because she starts her homework late. Let’s see how they try to solve the problem together:

character_1_text.eng: Come on, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, it's time to get ready for bed.

character_2_text.eng: But I still have so much homework to do!

character_3_text.eng: Hmm, this is the third night in a row that you haven’t gone to bed on time because of homework.

rows.character_1_text: Come on, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, it's time to get ready for bed.
rows.character_2_text: But I still have so much homework to do!
rows.character_3_text: Hmm, this is the third night in a row that you haven’t gone to bed on time because of homework.

character_1_text.eng: How can we make sure you get all your homework done and still get to bed on time so that you get enough sleep?

character_3_text.eng: Shall we make a rule that you start your homework an hour after you get home from school? That way, you can finish it and have some time to eat and relax before bed, too! I am happy to help you remember when to start.

rows.character_1_text: How can we make sure you get all your homework done and still get to bed on time so that you get enough sleep?
rows.character_3_text: Shall we make a rule that you start your homework an hour after you get home from school? That way, you can finish it and have some time to eat and relax before bed, too! I am happy to help you remember when to start.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, have you started your homework yet?

character_2_text.eng: I'll start now, Mama! But can you help me with this one problem? I was having trouble with it yesterday.

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, have you started your homework yet?
rows.character_2_text: I'll start now, Mama! But can you help me with this one problem? I was having trouble with it yesterday.

character_1_text.eng: Look, Mama, I'm ready for bed earlier tonight!

character_2_text.eng: Well done, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. I’m proud that we figured that problem out together. Now you can be well-rested for tomorrow, and your homework is complete!

rows.character_1_text: Look, Mama, I'm ready for bed earlier tonight!
rows.character_2_text: Well done, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name. I’m proud that we figured that problem out together. Now you can be well-rested for tomorrow, and your homework is complete!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f3_mother.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name worked together to solve their problem.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f3_mother.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name worked together to solve their problem.

quiz_1_question.eng: What problem did this family have?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name is still learning to manage her time well so that she has enough time to sleep after getting her homework done.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name is still learning to manage her time well.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name wasn’t lazy, but she was tired! She is still learning to manage her time well.

quiz_2_question.eng: What does @data.characters.f3_mother.name do to solve the problem together with @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: She reminds @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name that she has had this problem before.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: She asks @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to help come up with solutions

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: That’s right. The second step of problem solving is to jointly come up with solutions.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: She criticises her for not remembering to try the solution.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Hm. That’s not right. The third step to solving a problem is for @data.characters.f3_mother.name to encourage and support @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to try out the solution.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When a problem comes up, take a deep breath before you tackle it. 

Then help your child work on the problem with you using these four steps:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When a problem comes up, take a deep breath before you tackle it. 

Then help your child work on the problem with you using these four steps:

section_1_text.eng:
Put the problem into words.

Talk to your child about what the problem is.

section_1_extra_text.eng: "I can hear you arguing because you both want to use the tablet. I know I said you both could use it after you’ve helped tidy up your room but we only have one tablet. What should we do about this?"

section_2_text.eng:
Together, think of possible solutions to this problem.
What could you or your child do differently in this situation in the future?

section_2_extra_text.eng: "One option is for us not to use the tablet at all. Or you could take turns using it. Or you could watch something on it together. What do you both think?"

section_3_text.eng:
Choose one solution together.

Try it next time you are in a similar situation, and praise your child for trying!

section_3_extra_text.eng:
The next day after the room has been tidied up by the children...

"Okay boys, do you remember what we said last night about the tablet? Who can remember the solution we came up with?"
"That's right – well done for remembering! Let's try to pick something that you both want to watch – I may even come watch with you!"

section_4_text.eng: After you’ve tried it, decide with your child whether or not your solution worked.

section_4_extra_text.eng: After the YouTube video ends... "Well that was an exciting video! I never knew I liked watching diving so much, so thank you for introducing me to something new! I think we all had fun watching that together, so I look forward to seeing what you pick to watch tomorrow."

"That's right – well done for remembering! Let's try to pick something that you both want to watch – I may even come watch with you!"

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s think of some common problems we could solve with our children.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s think of some common problems we could solve with our children.

quiz_1_question.eng: Do you experience any of these problems at home?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Talk with your child and use the steps of problem-solving together to come up with solutions that you can try out.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Talk with your child and use the steps of problem-solving together to come up with solutions that you can try out.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Your home activity is to identify a problem your child may have and practise the four steps of problem-solving together: 
Know It, Solve It, Try It, Reflect. 

Knowing how to solve problems is something they can use for the rest of their lives!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Your home activity is to identify a problem your child may have and practise the four steps of problem-solving together: 
Know It, Solve It, Try It, Reflect. 

Knowing how to solve problems is something they can use for the rest of their lives!

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you try to solve a problem with your child?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Remember to praise them for their effort, and praise yourself, too! Well done!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's great! Remember to praise them for their effort, and praise yourself, too! Well done!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. Try to work on a simple problem with your child, before you tackle a big one together.
